comment.narrative: Conducting NMAS baseline assessments has not been possible during 2021 due to Covid-19 restrictions and lockdowns globally. The GICHD has however identified that addressing the issue of managing liabilities in MA operations was an area of concern for many National Mine Action Authorities and operators alike. As identified in previous GICHD assessments, addressing liabilities is important for the overall improvement of the NMAS frameworks. During the reporting period, the GICHD has designed a questionnaire on liability, which was shared with 42 NMAA and 11 Mine Action organisations and operators. The questionnaire will set a baseline for the main challenges facing NMAA and programs with regards to addressing liabilities and possible areas for supporting the enhancement of National Mine Action Standards in various countries, thereby identifying potential areas for further NMAS assessments.

During the reporting period, GICHD supported the Directorate of Mine Action Coordination (DMAC) in Afghanistan in drafting and finalising a liability policy. By the end of the reporting period the policy draft will be completed and undergo internal review at the GICHD and DMAC Technical Working Group.
NMAS assessments have not yet been completed, ongoing work on priority setting for NMAS.
